title: ! Temporary leave of absence !
content: Just a quickie to notify the users and visitors of the Type Identification Board that the head moderator is on vacation till September 1st. Please don’t mind the mess. Normal service will resume in two short weeks.
author: Bald Condensed

comments.content: Enjoy your time off, Yves. I’m sure you’ve been super busy and deserve the break. Try not to ID all the type you see while on vacation. ;o)
Have fun!

Have a good one! I know it’s well deserved time off.

Cheers

Yves on vacation? Now here’s my chance! _NOT._

Hi everyone, greetings from [Gregolimano](http://web.archive.org/web/20060905190056/http:/www.nyloo.com/html/ent/792/ent.40792.1.asp)! Enjoying my last days off and looking forward to my return on my favourite Typophile Board. I can actually waterski now! And guess what? After all those years I finally managed to read a [serious book](http://web.archive.org/web/20060905190056/http:/www.nologo.org/), like, with real paper pages ‘n’ stuff! :^D

David, I’ve learned one thing here: IDing Greek type is twice as hard as the usual key glyphs (e.g. ‘a’, ‘g’, ‘G’ etc.) are absent in the Greek alphabet. Hard work! ;^P

Yves, since you are itching to ID some fonts, here is one just for you!
